text: No sound. We are in a speeding SUV. The passenger, LARA, unsnaps her seat belt and reaches for the door handle. Th driver, JOHN, sees her door open and dives to GRAB her. T SUV spins, HORNS BLARE, TIRES SCREECH, cars swerve to avo collision. We aren't sure what is happening, but we know something has gone terribly wrong. Cut to BLACK. Read:

Two couples sit at a table, picking at dessert, JOHN and LARA BRENNAN on one side, MICK and ERIT on the other. JOH is attractive in a worn kind of way, but has the eyes of kid with a discipline problem. You have to really know hi to understand if he is mocking you or agreeing with you. is a master of irony and has a true enjoyment of the absu LARA looks beautiful even in her wrinkled suit. She appea to have had a hard day at the office. She's been drinking at dinner; it hasn't eased her nerves. John's good-lookin brother, MICK, boasts his blue collar roots and a gorgeou if slightly trashy, girlfriend, ERIT, who isn't ashamed o her body or sharing her opinions. JOHN and MICK are laugh Lara puts cash on the tray beside Mick's credit card.
You know what? If you were smart you would stop talking right now.
Sue me. I just know that women should never work for women. John laughs and applauds.   Mick buries his head.
How can you say that??
They're always threatened. Especially if you're beautiful and they're not.
Erit, you are so full of shit.
So, your boss isn't threatened by you?
Because she's a bitch! -- (as John and Mick laugh)
--Not because she's a woman.
And you would describe her as "attractive"?
That has nothing to do with it!
And there is my answer.
Either of you like another drink? Lara shoots John a burning look as Erit builds on her vic
Women should work under men, men under women. That's it.
(egging her on)
But men under men?
That's fine, too. (the men burst into laughter)
They're used to it! Why are you laughing?
(re: Erit)
I don't know, bro, but I think I'd rather work under you than her.
(insulted, shoots back)
Oh please, I'd rather work under him, too. That was a dig at Mick but Lara is primed for a fight.
You'd rather "work under" John?
You have a problem with that, too?
No, why would I have a problem with your little sexual innuendo?
What is up your ass tonight?? Mick throws John a "This is all your fault and now it is going to explode" look. John feigns complete innocence.
So, I shouldn't take offense that you're coming on to my husband right in front of me.
(claws out now)
Lara, if I wanted your husband I would have him.
How? You couldn't possibly show him more of your tits. The men are on their feet before blows are exchanged.
-- You know what your problem is?!
That was a great meal!           Okay--okay!
Mick and Erit head toward Mick's sporty pickup.     John Lara step into foreground, Lara still fuming.
She is completely full of shit.
DON'T try and agree with me now.
You know what? I don't even believe she is in the dental profession. Lara knows this game; he is trying to get her out of her black mood, and she has no intention of letting him.
Shut up.
I bet she can't even spell anesthesiologist. Woman's a complete fraud.
We went to her office party, idiot.
I think she hit on me that night, too. Lara opens the back door of their black Prius and tosses the raincoat she was carrying. They climb in, under....
You are completely delusional. She wasn't even hitting on you in there; I just don't like her.
I understand. People who look like that should not be allowed anywhere near oral surgery. She feels a smile coming to her lips and tries to force i away.
You are such an asshole.

You're in the chair trying to stay calm; how are you supposed to do that with those things hanging over your-- She can't stand how attractive he is in this moment -- sh stops him short by kissing him passionately. His hands sl under her blouse; she tugs at his sweater.

Someone's going to -- Her hand goes to his pants. He yanks at the seat lever an it goes crashing back, Lara landing atop him. After a moment he sits up quickly and pushes down the vis She laughs and kisses him and they disappear into each ot
Lara and John enter, Lara carrying her raincoat, her hair sticking up in the back, John's shirt untucked.
Hello! JENNA, the teenage baby-sitter, sees right through them.
Did he cry?
Only when I dropped him down the stairs. Lara shoots her a look, hangs up her coat and exits upsta
She peeks in her son's room, sees him sleeping soundly.
Lara comes down to find John paying Jenna. John nods for her to check the mirror. She tugs at the knot in her hair

Thanks.   See you next weekend. Jenna exits. Lara shows him that his sweater is inside ou John reacts: "Oh God." Lara's smile broadens; she kisses him. He pins her to the wall and they start all over agai He feels for the light switch. He finds it; we cut to BLA
Lara wakes, troubled.      It's the middle of the night.
Lara finds Luke's window closed but unlocked. She locks i and looks out. Satisfied, she sits and watches her son sl
Three year-old LUKE holds a knife and fork as he sits at table watching his dad cut up his pancakes.
Okay, your turn. Luke skewers a piece with his fork.        Lara passes, h to get to work.
Very good, very good...
Luke puts it in his mouth.
No, no, no; you feed me. (to Lara)
Your son is hopeless. Lara grabs her phone and leans over them to take a photo.
Squeeze in tight.
You can't do this every morning.   It is way too corny.
Smile.   It's just until he's eighteen. It flashes. Lara kisses John, puts an alien-looking elect toothbrush on the table & walks off to pour coffee to go.
Present.
(examining it)
Sweetie, you have to stop believing everything you read in a catalogue.
You hate brushing your teeth; this one brushes them in thirty seconds.
(as if stung)
I love brushing my teeth. (to Luke)
The lies your mother tells.
(ignoring him)
When's your last class?
Three, and I have papers to grade. Can you pick up Luke?
After yesterday I probably don't have a job anyway. Do you think it was wrong to call her a useless cow?
Bosses admire that kind of frank                          exchange.
(pulls note off fridge) Did you call your father?
When?
(heading for bathroom) "When?" Yesterday, for his birthday!
Lara puts her foot up and jabs herself with insulin.
I sent him flowers and a handmade card.
You're completely impossible.
Did you notice what I got for my birthday this year? A grunt.
Mom said Happy Birthday and my father went
. Made me tear up. Lara returns, trying hard not to smile.
Ever think that someone has to be the bigger person here?
(to Luke) Remember this for the custody hearing: how Mommy is always scolding Daddy.
How are you going to feel if Luke grows up and doesn't call you?
Lara can't keep a straight face and heads to the foyer.
Now she's driving a wedge between us.
I give up.
And now she is abandoning you.
Lara grabs her raincoat and notices a stain on the back shoulder. Irritated, she heads back to the bathroom.
Lara rinses the stain under the sink, surprised to see it run red. She looks at her hands: blood. The doorbell ring
John rises to answer the door.
Lara looks at her coat, wonders how the hell she got bloo on her shoulder. She rubs liquid soap into it.
As John opens the door, DETECTIVE QUINN shows his badge. DETECTIVE COLLERO and a team of detectives push past. Joh has no time to react.
Police.   Mr. Brennan?
LUKE sees the police rush past him and gets scared.
My name is Detective Quinn. This is a search warrant for these premises.
John hears Luke cry and instinctively heads inside.
(stops him) Stay where you are.
Get your --
Touch me again and you'll be arrested.
Lara steps from the bathroom and is met by Detective Coll She sees the coat with the water spot; nods to a team mem who takes it and bags it under:
Lara Brennan?
Lara Brennan, you are under arrest for the murder of Elizabeth Gesas. She takes her wrist and professionally turns and cuffs he
She's dead??     Elizabeth is dead??
(tries to push past)
She didn't do anything!
I will only --
(tries again)
She didn't do anything!
Put him in cuffs. The uniform pushes him up against the wall and cuffs his wrists. John watches as his child cries, his wife is led out in handcuffs and the house is torn apart. Cut to BLAC
Daddy!...    DADDY!! A light comes on.   John steps out of his bedroom and ent his son's room.
It's okay.     Just a bad dream. He comes back out carrying Luke, now SIX YEARS-OLD.
John lays Luke on the bed and climbs in beside him.
You okay?
Luke nods.
Okay, you can sleep here as long as you stay on this side of the bed.
Luke immediately scrambles over his father to take his si
You're such a snake, I don't know why I keep falling for the same trick.

John kisses Luke, who closes his eyes and snuggles his pi John reaches for the lamp. Beside it sits the framed phot that Lara snapped of the three of them that fateful morni He switches off the lamp, and the screen goes BLACK.
The "T," the city's fast-moving trolley, rises up from underground and we CRANE UP to see the city.
But Sam's your friend, right?
Tilt down from a passing T-Train to find John and Luke, walking toward the huge, modern Allegheny County Jail.
Not at lunch.
Does he take your food?
No.
Did he say something mean? (Luke nods) About Mommy?
Yeah.
Did you hit him?
Yeah.
Good.    Where did you hit him?
Near the swings.
Wow.    I bet that hurt.
Yeah.

- John waits in a long line, mostly women. He glances ove at the pleasant and colorful play area in the corner and sees children playing. Luke plays by himself. - John puts his key ring in a plastic container. The guar takes it and puts the keys with other visitors' belonging John guides his son toward the metal detector. Luke walks through and the buzzer goes off. John instinctively moves forward to help. A guard stops h with a hand on his chest. On the other side of the metal detector another guard runs a wand over Luke, pulls somet from his pocket, looks at it curiously.
It's a toy!
The guard runs the wand over the child again; no screech. The guard waves John through. No beep. John kneels and pulls on Luke's jacket.
Don't worry.     We'll get it back.
They walk along the hall with all the other visitors.

John stares out the window at the city beyond.    Life se so close. He looks back into the large communal visiting room; a do round tables and plastic chairs. The concrete block walls are covered with naive paintings in bright colors and mes of hope. Luke plays at his feet with a basket of Legos. The door at the far side buzzes, a guard opens it and prisoners in red jump-suits marked VISITING ROOM enter. Lara enters and looks around. She is pale, thin and her hair has returned to its natural color. Lara hurries to h and gives him a real kiss. She breaks and steps to Luke, who plays with his back to her.
Hi honey. Can Mommy get a kiss? (no response. Tickles him)
Come on, give Mommy a kiss.
Rat-Bag.   Give Mommy a kiss. He gives her a peck on the cheek and goes back to his Leg
Is Daddy reading you my letters?
Every night at bedtime.
What are you building?    A fort? Lara pulls him into a hug; no response. She kisses his he and sits at the table with John. She squeezes his hand.
Was he scared going to school?
I walked him to class, gave him a kiss; he didn't even look back to wave.
What did you make him for lunch?
Turkey sandwich, just butter and bread, no "vegetables" on it. He swore he ate his apple.
He hands her a pack of photos.      Lara devours them.
Look at his friends.   And his desk. This is his teacher?
Miss Phillips.
You may have to move to another school district.
Already spoke to a realtor.
(still looking at photos) How was your first day?
Excellent. Over half my class stayed awake. Talked to your mom.
When is she coming?
She's having a lot of trouble with her business.
It's only been a couple of years, I'm sure she'll get around to it. (beat) Have you heard anything?
About the appeal? Yes, and I'm just not telling you. What did Meyer say?
--Don't--
-- It can take months for the court to rule.
I saw that woman. She was there. She couldn't have just disappeared.
Meyer's looking for a new investigator.
Her coat snagged my purse, I felt a button pop - they must have been blind not to find it.
He'll go through all the evidence again.
Great, because I haven't quite bankrupted us yet.
We're doing fine.
(fondly) You just lie and lie. (strokes his face) But you are very handsome. (admiring him) Can you do me a favor?
I don't know, I'm a little busy.
I need you to run for governor.
-- Oh, that I can do.
You can change this rule about no conjugal visits, because I don't think I can last another twenty years.
She smiles but is already traveling toward a dark place. reaches out and holds her tight, stroking her back.
I'm okay.   I'm okay.
I know. But it's going to be fine. I promise.
She just stares at Luke, his back to them, playing.
You think he'll ever want to kiss me again?
The prisoners file out and are patted down. Lara turns an blows Luke and John a kiss. They watch with the other visitors, who all stand on the far side of the room.

Lara and the female inmates pull off their visiting jump- suits and hand them to a female guard, who searches them contraband. Lara retrieves her regular jump-suit and pull it on over her underwear. Another small, daily humiliatio

Start VERY CLOSE ON JOHN'S DIGITAL WATCH. Widen to see Lu standing on a low step at the sink in his pajamas using a complicated-looking electric toothbrush. John sits on the toilet, staring at his watch.
Twenty-eight, twenty-nine, thirty.
Luke puts it down and checks his teeth in the mirror.
Good?
Luke nods.
The garage door opens; the Prius has a lot more miles on John backs out, Luke in his child seat. He brakes and fin PAULA, the woman who lives behind them, at his window.
How's Lara?
She's doing okay.
Tell her we're pulling for her.
I will.
She holds up a plastic water bottle.
They won't recycle these unless you take off the cap. (cap vs. bottle) This is trash. This is recyclable.
Ok.   Thanks.
John drives off, wondering what kind of world he lives in
Sitting on the park bench, John allows his feelings to wa over his face. He watches Luke play with a girl his age.
Luke!   Let's go, Toad.   Come on.
Luke runs to him. John pulls Luke's jacket on. He doesn't notice the young mother on the next bench, NICOLE, watchi him admiringly. She calls to the girl Luke was playing wi
Time to go, Carrie!
John glances in time to see CARRIE plop down in the sand, arms folded. He shares a sympathetic smile with Nicole, w heads to retrieve her daughter. John walks off with Luke.
John waits as a courtroom lets out. MEYER FISK steps out with a young associate. He spots John and approaches.
John, I said my office at four o'clock. I can't leave, I'm in --
(holds up a Subway bag) I figured you had to eat.
Meyer relents, turns and calls to his associate.
Do you have the ruling in Brennan?
She kneels and digs through her rolling briefcase.
John sits on a bench, pale and shaken, flipping through t ruling. The courtroom is empty, save a bailiff eating at his desk. During this he gets up and walks out past them.
But what if we find the woman who                         was leaving the parking lot?
The PCRA was rejected. No new evidence can be submitted. Not anymore.
It was a robbery!   Someone stole her purse!
And if they'd used her credit cards we would have had something to argue. I'm sorry; this really...sucks.
John offers a smile at Meyer's unlawyer-like choice of wo
So, that's it. Now we just have the Supreme Court.
John, in the last thirty years, the Supreme Court hasn't heard one murder case. No decent lawyer would even file the pleadings.
So, I need to find an indecent one?
No, I'm going to file it. But I need you to do something for me.
Anything.
I need you to look at the evidence and just forget Lara is your wife.
(stopped by that) I've seen the evidence, Meyer.
I'm not saying judge her innocent or guilty, I'm just saying look at it. He co-worker sees her leaving the scene, she has the victim's blood on her clothes, her fingerprints on the murder weapon--
(is this a bad joke?) We went out for dinner! How do you do that after you kill somebody? She would have to be a psychopath!
-- And the fight in the office.
Everyone fights with their boss!
But this one ended up dead.
John looks at Meyer anew, feeling profoundly betrayed.
So, you never believed she was innocent?
How can you say that?
So, what are you saying, Meyer?!
That it no longer matters what we believe; Lara's not getting out. And you have no idea how much I hate saying that.
(exiting) I'll find someone to file the pleadings.
John! Come on! For Christ's sake. JOHN!!
John is long gone.    Meyer hurls his sandwich into the t

John waits alone on the visitors' side of the glass. The door opens, and Lara steps up on the other side. John smi and picks up the phone, but Lara sees something in his fa and doesn't pick up her phone, just stares at him. John fights to keep his smile and nods for her to pick up her phone -- but now she can see the verdict chiseled on face. Lara gasps and cries inconsolably. John keeps the smile plastered on his face, but now tears run down his cheeks. He taps on the glass and points at h phone, but she doesn't respond. He taps harder and harder desperately wanting to comfort her, but she won't allow i He bangs on the glass with his fist, drawing the attentio of the guard on his side. Lara turns and exits. John stands and yells her name, but she can't hear it, and neither can we.
We're in an old working class neighborhood.    John sits his car, trying to pull himself together.

MICK opens the door. GRACE, their mother, looks up from clearing the lunch dishes. John's face tells them everyth they need to know. Mick slams his fist against the door. In the back yard with Luke, GEORGE, John's father turns t see Grace tearfully embrace John. George looks away, uncomfortable, and distracts Luke's attention.

John, Mick and Grace sit in the worn wicker chairs on the back porch. Erit steps out with beers to replace their empties. She sits and they stare off, watching Luke and George play with the dog. After a moment Erit looks to Jo
I know you won't want to hear this...
-- Erit, go put somebody to sleep.
She stares unbelieving, then walks off in a huff.
Thanks.
Had to be done. (long beat) I am really going to pay for that.
John has to smile.

John drives through a rough part of town on their way hom He stops at a light and notes the dealers on the corner. flashy car pulls up, hands are slapped; call the driver D He takes a roll of cash from the dealer, looks around, ca John staring. John looks away quickly and drives off.
John sits at his desk, surrounded by boxes of documents a photographs. As John sifts through the evidence...
Lara and her boss ELIZABETH argue loudly.

It's RAINING outside. ELIZABETH stands at her car door in small, partially covered garage -- maybe a dozen spots. S turns toward camera -- A FIRE EXTINGUISHER comes right at camera, making a terri impact and ELIZABETH collapses to the floor.
Lara turns, holding the fire extinguisher.
As he flips through a handwritten witness statement.
Lara's car speeds out of the parking lot. A male co-worke steps out of the rain just as her car passes. He stops as he sees ELIZABETH'S BODY lying beside her car.
Lara tries to scrub the blood off of her coat.
The phone beside him SHRIEKS.   John picks it up.
It's late; prime time for the ER.    John runs in.
John enters breathlessly and finds the Nurses' Station.
Lara Brennan; my wife. She was sent up here. Brennan. B-R-
(finds name in roster)
She can't have visitors.
That's ridiculous; I have to see her.
I'm sorry. John turns away and heads down the corridor to find her himself. The Duty Nurse sees this and takes off after him
You can't go down there! John shoves open a door, moves on to the next.
You can't be in here!!
Lara!
(running up) I got him!
Lara!
A long-haired doctor, BECSEY, steps into his path.
What's going on?!
My wife attempted suicide.
Let's go.                                (hands doctor ch
I have to see her!
Why isn't she in the ER?
I'm not asking. Now.                   She's a transfer f
Please.   Two minutes.
Becsey is not unmoved.       He shares a look with the nu
DR. Becsey opens the door for John.          Note a priso standing outside.
Two minutes.

Becsey leaves. A uniformed female prison guard looks up from her magazine and keeps her eyes on John. He looks to his wife, who's attached to an I.V. and monitors, pale an weak, her arm bandaged where she cut it open along the ar Lara opens her heavy eyelids and John glimpses something terrible in her eyes: she's tortured to be alive. He knee beside her and puts a hand on the bed. She takes his litt finger, wraps her fingers around it.
John opens the door to let Jenna out; she looks considera older.
I'm sorry. He just keeps pretending he's asleep.
(reaching for his wallet)
Don't worry about it.
It's okay.
I insist.    I kept you out on a school night.
I'm not in school anymore. She offers a sad smile and leaves without the cash.
Luke lies in the crook of his father's arm, his own arms full of penguins, turtles, a black dog and an opossum. Jo reads him a letter, the yellow envelope open on the bed.
And give a big hug to Pengui, Little Pengui, Big Turtley, Little Turtley, Kiki and Opossumy. Lots and lots of love, Mommy. (beat)
You gonna give them hugs from her? (no response)
Should we write her back?
...When is she coming home?
Soon honey.    Soon.
(thinks for a moment, then:)
Can I have a quarter?
Can you have a quarter?
Luke points at the glass coin dish on night stand.
Ohhh. Sure, but you can't spend those. They come from the cottage where Mommy and I used to take you when you were a baby.
Then can I have them all?
...Sure.
He hands Luke the jar, and hoists up him and his animals.

Luke sets the coin jar on his nightstand. John tucks him with his animals, then switches off the lamp. John looks back before closing it and watches Luke lie awake, starin at the jar, lost in confused thoughts of his mother.

Dirty dishes piled in the sink, John unloads the dishwash He finds the handle has cracked off Luke's favorite mug. places the cup and handle on the counter, opens a drawer crammed with tools and screws and tape and such. He rumma through it. Not finding what he is looking for, he pulls handfuls of junk out of the drawer and slams it all down the counter. The harder he searches the more he becomes frustrated, until he slams the drawer and leans on the counter, feeling destroyed and needy. And then a female hand appears beside him, opens another drawer and reaches in. John stares at the hand, afraid to move, afraid to look up. The hand finds a tube of glue, places it on the counter and moves away. John turns to see LARA walking away. She turns, smiling a shaking her head, and disappears into the dining room. Stunned, John looks down at the glue on the counter, then suddenly pushes away and rushes into the dining room. No sign of her. And she isn't in the living room. He bolts into the foyer and finds the front door slightly ajar. He flings it open...
John rushes out into the street, looking up and down for finally realizing she was never there.
He stands in the middle of the street, now searching for way to survive.
Don Quixote is written on the chalkboard.
So, what is it about?   Julie?
That belief in someone's virtue is more important than virtue itself?
No. I mean, yes, that's in there. But what is it about?
No takers.
It is about how rational thought destroys the soul. It is about the triumph of irrationality, and the power that is in it.

John drops an armload of books into a library cart, each having something to do with prison or prison life. He sits at a table at the back, flipping through them one a time and discards each in turn. As the shadows grow longer we find him staring at the com screen linked to the school system. ON THE SCREEN: a book summary disappears, to be replaced the school search engine -- many of the items have alread been inspected. John finds one that reads "Over The Walls He clicks on the link and the title page appears. The aut is DAMON PENNINGTON. There's a photo of him. The caption reads that he LIVES IN BROOKLYN, NY.
John gets out of a cab and heads into a local dive bar.
A couple of guys at the bar yell at the dog race on the T screen. DAMON hands John a beer and nods toward a table.
It's a course that investigates what drives men to be free, no matter the cost.
Somebody else had dibs on Papillon?
You escaped from jail seven times.
Damon lights a cigarette.       A TOUGH GUY nearby object
No smoking!!
Yeah, who would want to cut short your precious life?
Damon takes a deep drag.
Mind if I tape you?
Go for it, it can't be used as evidence. What do you want to know?
John sets up the small digital recorder.
How you escaped when no one else could.
Balls and a little luck. (beat) No prison in the world is airtight. Each one has a key. You have to find it.
How do you do that?
A lot of looking. Especially at things that break the daily routine. Guards get comfortable doing the same thing every day. Something happens where they have to think, adapt.

That's when they will make mistakes. But when you see it you have to be ready. You have to have the entire plan already in place before you even know how you are going to get out of the jail. Escaping is easy; the hardest part is staying free.
The tape recorder plays Damon's voice; John tears large s of art paper from a pad and tacks them to his bedroom wal
You have to know where you are going to go and how you are going to get there. You have to know how they plan to catch you, where, and when.
How the hell do you know that?
He starts to write on the paper with a large felt marker.
You pay off someone who knows. And a lot depends on if the prison is in the country or the city.
The city.
That came out too quickly. Damon now understands. John sits, silent, knowing he blew it. Damon takes his time.
Where are you from?
...Pittsburgh.
Pittsburgh is tough; so many bridges and tunnels they can block off.
The art paper bunches and rips under the pressure of the marker. John tears it off the wall.
From the time they make the call, the police can have the center of the city sealed tight in fifteen minutes.
How can they be so exact?
After 9-11 Homeland Security made every city have a lock-down plan -- downtown Pittsburgh, Philly, Boston, Minneapolis -- fifteen minutes. They can do DC in under ten.
John draws a circle on the wall and writes in it: 15 MINU
Within thirty-five minutes they will have cops at every tollbooth on the interstate --
-- Surrounds it by a larger circle: 35 MINUTES.
And be running rolling stops on the secondary roads. They won't have your photograph yet, but they will have your description.
He draws spokes out from the circles.
What if you can't make it out?
Thirty-five minutes isn't a lot of time.
Then surrender.
Because they will shoot you on sight, along with anyone you are with.
John writes DESCRIPTION at the end of one spoke.
Stay far away from the train and bus stations.
Forget the local airports.   Leave from another state.
John scribbles key words on the wall.     DISTANT AIRPORT
Second: identity. It's easy to find fake papers, harder to find ones that will get you through an airport.
John writes "IDENTITIES."
You'll need a passport, driver's license and a social security number.
If you have to rent a car, find a place that will take a cash deposit. They'll still run a credit check, so use a real person's name on the ID. (beat) Third: destination.
John writes furiously on the wall.    "DESTINATION."
You want somewhere that doesn't attract American tourists and doesn't get American newspapers. Think Yemen and you get the idea.
Then money.
John's writes "MONEY."
You need a truck load of it. Everything's expensive: hotels, travel, information.
How much?
Enough to last at least five-six years. Run out of money and you run out of friends.
John underlines "MONEY."
John is starting to understand the enormity of this undertaking.

But before you do anything, you have to ask yourself if you can do it. Can you forget about ever seeing your parents again. Can you kill a guard, leave your kid at a gas station, push a nice old lady to the ground because she is between you and the door? Because to do this thing, that's who you have to become. And if you can't, don't start, because you'll just get someone killed.
John backs away from the wall to see it covered in a spid of notes.
How did you get caught?
I gave myself up. I couldn't take wondering when someone was going to come through the bedroom door. (beat)
Got what you need?
Yeah.
What do you have in your pocket? John opens his billfold.   Damon takes the cash, leaves h twenty.
On the wall we see the massive diagram John has created. The screen goes BLACK. Read: THE LAST THREE MONTHS
The train crosses a bridge.
John rides, looking down at the river below.
John steps through the puffer (the machine that detects d and into the secure area. He makes a mental note of everything he sees: the number of guards, cameras, etc.
John sits in his car on the road above, surreptitiously t pictures of the vehicles coming and going from the prison
He tapes the photos to the wall.

Walking down a corridor with the other visitors, John ste in a puddle of water. Behind him the others notice and st around it. Moving on, they pass a trustee on a ladder pul a water-stained ceiling tile away as two guards watch.
John traces a route on a map with a highlighter.
